text: Thanks Jeff! I got the server setup and I also setup FTP but im having a hard time figuring out how to use it in conjunction with the local dev setup

I don't think that's something they have quite ready yet... the local server works great for compiling hubl, but I don't know of a way to bring in the surrounding context of the website for an accurate preview of how it will look in the portal.  I believe the best solution right now is to create a dev portal as close to production as possible, and use the local dev tools to work in that.  A few of us have created gulp tasks to make this a pretty smooth process. See <https://github.com/teunrutten/HubSpot-boilerplate> courtesy of <@UGDF9EBPW>

Hey y'all... I'm updating my gulp task to use the new `hscms upload` instead of `hscms sync`. It seems as though `upload` requires you to target a specific file, whereas `sync` let you sync an entire directory. Is that right?
Exactly, a sandbox portal is the best way to seperate your production and development environment. I can not wait till local with hot reloading is also possible.
Hey Doug! If you update to use the latest version of the tools, `upload` has replaced `sync`, and does both single file uploads or directory uplaods
Ah, I'll check to make sure it actually updated...
If you have the tools installed globally, you can run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` to update your version
Yes, updating to 0.0.24 seems to have resolved it. Thanks Will!
PS, great dev meetup yesterday, we watched from Chicago
Awesome, glad it is working now!
